name: Weyerhaeuser Co. v. Ross-Simmons Hardwood Lumber Co.

opinion.reasoning: The general theoretical similarities of monopoly and monopsony combined with the theoretical and practical similarities of predatory pricing and predatory bidding convince us that our two-pronged Brooke Group test should apply to predatory-bidding claims.

precedent.name: Brooke Group Ltd. v. Brown & Williamson Tobacco Corp.
Salop, Steven C., Monopsony, Mergers, and Antitrust
precedent.caseNumber: 6 Harvard Journal of Law & Public Policy 675

precedent.name: Blair, Roger D., and Harrison, William T., Predatory Pricing: Strategic Theory and Legal Policy

outcome: Vacated the judgment of the Court of Appeals and remanded the case for further proceedings consistent with this opinion.
